content: Very complex, and interesting question… Ultimately, what matters is that there is no place for more than two dominant OS (irrespective on how good/bad they can be …), because developers cannot bear the cost of multiple ports. In the case of the watch, there is indeed a notion of an ecosystem, with third party apps, but it can be argued that the number of apps is much more limited than on other platforms, and that most of the users will not care at all anyway. And by the way, the same question could be raised for cars, with several more orders of magnitude ….
